articles.title: Swedish Preparatory Committee Inaugurated
articles.content:
Swedish Preparatory Committee Inaugurated 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Swedish preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun was held in Stockholm on Mar. 11.
 The ceremony elected Chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association Christer Lundgren chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to organize a commemoration meeting and other colorful functions in league with different political parties and to publish and disseminate magazine "Information of Korea".

articles.title: Songun Politics of DPRK Highly Praised in Different Countries
articles.content:
Songun Politics of DPRK Highly Praised in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Romanian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy held a seminar and a book and photo exhibition on Mar. 7 and 10 on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
 Displayed at the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos showing the exploits of their Songun leadership.
 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Romanian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said at the seminar that the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is a good political mode of helping glorify the sovereignty and dignity of the country under the uplifted banner of socialism at the present times when the moves of the imperialists to isolate and stifle the DPRK have been pronounced. He pointed out that Korean-style socialism is now further developing thanks to the Songun politics.
 Miriam Pelegrini Feri, president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy, at the opening ceremony of the book and photo exhibition said that some time ago his group published   Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science", stressing that it would make a deep study of Kim Jong Il's works and the Songun idea he has enriched and widely disseminate them among the masses.

articles.title: Disorganization of GNP of S. Korea Demanded in Britain
articles.content:
Disorganization of GNP of S. Korea Demanded in Britain 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the British Association for the Study of the Songun Policy and the British Friendship Society with Korea made public a joint statement on Mar. 2 denouncing the moves of the pro-U.S. ultra-rightist conservatives of south Korea and demanding the disorganization of the Grand National Party of south Korea.
 The statement held that the merger of the GNP and the United Liberal Democrats is an extremely grave act as it is intended to revive the past fascist dictatorship, more zealously pursue pro-Americanism and flunkeyism, scrap the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and drive the relations between the north and the south to confrontation.    
 The statement supported the declaration on the situation issued by the Central Committee of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front which assailed the above-said merger as a criminal conspiracy and extended firm solidarity to the south Korean people in their struggle to force the pro-U.S. fascist GNP to disband itself.

Suppression of Chongryon Condemned in Japan
articles.content:
Suppression of Chongryon Condemned in Japan 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Japanese political and public circles condemned the authorities for suppressing the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and violating the human rights of Koreans in Japan.
 The New Socialist Party of Japan in a statement on February 16 castigated the Fukuoka High Court for deciding to cancel a measure for exempting the Kumamoto Korean Hall, a facility related to Chongryon, from taxation and branded the decision as an open crackdown on Chongryon, which curries favor with the right-wing forces in intensifying national discrimination and chauvinism against the Koreans in Japan and keeps in step with the government's hostile policy toward the DPRK.
 Pointing out that the decision is unwarrantable, the statement called upon the Japanese people to strengthen the movement for its withdrawal. 
 The Japanese Aichi, Mie Liaison Council for Supporting Korea's Reunification made public a statement on March 6 to condemn the Nagoya Immigration Office for delaying a reentry permit of the chairperson of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Democratic Korean Women in Japan.    
 The statement emphasized that unpardonable is such violation of human rights to discriminate and oppress those victims forcibly drafted by Japan's aggression and colonial rule of Korea and Koreans in Japan, their descendants, and block their visit to the homeland.

articles.title: Halt to Moves to Provoke War Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Moves to Provoke War Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity for the Implementation of the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration and Peace on the Korean Peninsula made public a statement on Mar. 11 demanding  the U.S. and south Korean military authorities immediately stop their moves to provoke a war.
 The statement charged that the U.S. seeks to round off its scenario for another Korean war through the north-targeted military exercises to be staged soon, timed to coincide with the large-scale relocation of its forces in south Korea, the "conversion of its forces into rapid deployment forces and the realization of their strategic flexibility," etc. 
 Branding these war exercises as hostile acts against the nation and reunification as they deter the inter-Korean relations from heading for reconciliation, cooperation and reunification, the statement noted that all the facts clearly prove that the U.S. has no will to solve the Korean issue peacefully.

Koreans in U.S. Called for Participating in Joint National Functions
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Called for Participating in Joint National Functions
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The third meeting of co-chairmen of the U.S. Regional Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration took place in New York on March 4, according to U.S. Internet homepage Minjok Thongsin.
 Reports on activities for preparations for forming regional organizations to implement the joint declaration were made at the meeting. Then followed speeches on the working plan and the orientation of activities for 2006 of the U.S. Regional Committee.
 Reporters and speakers stressed the need to expand the organization from the stance that all the forces supporting the June 15 joint declaration should be involved in it. 
�@They called upon the Koreans in the United States to take an active part in joint national functions to be held on the occasion of the sixth anniversary of the publication of the joint declaration and successfully hold all-compatriots regional functions in different parts of the U.S. on this occasion.    
 They also declared that they would conduct a dynamic work to distribute diverse articles for the implementation of the joint declaration among those concerned in the U.S.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Ireland
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Ireland
    Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to President of Ireland Mary Mcaleese on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wholeheartedly wished the president of Ireland great success in his work for the prosperity of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue developing on good terms.
